intro: Urginea mankonensis, commonly known as the Mokonense bulb, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its large, fleshy underground bulbs. The plant produces tall, erect stems with narrow, linear leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. It is adapted to arid environments and has a long dormancy period during dry seasons. The bulb is sometimes used in traditional medicine, though its botanical properties remain under study.
